name: Classic Tarot
description: Traditional 22 major arcana cards with rich symbolic meanings

cards.name: The Fool
cards.description: A young person stands at the edge of a cliff, ready to take a leap of faith into the unknown. The Fool represents new beginnings, infinite potential, and the courage to embark on life's journey.

cards.name: The Magician
cards.description: The Magician stands with one hand pointing to the sky and one to the earth, channeling cosmic energy. He represents the power to manifest dreams into reality through focus and will.

cards.name: The High Priestess
cards.description: Seated between two pillars, the High Priestess guards the mysteries of the unconscious mind. She represents intuition, psychic abilities, and the wisdom found in silence.

cards.name: The Empress
cards.description: The Empress sits in a lush garden, representing the nurturing aspect of femininity, creativity, and abundance. She embodies fertility, beauty, and the power of nature.

cards.name: The Emperor
cards.description: The Emperor sits on a throne of stone, representing authority, structure, and paternal power. He embodies leadership, stability, and the establishment of order.

cards.name: The Hierophant
cards.description: The Hierophant represents spiritual wisdom, tradition, and the bridge between heaven and earth. He symbolizes conventional knowledge, religious beliefs, and moral guidance.

cards.name: The Lovers
cards.description: Two figures stand beneath an angel, representing love, union, and important life choices. The Lovers card symbolizes relationships, harmony, and moral decisions.

cards.name: The Chariot
cards.description: A warrior rides a chariot pulled by two sphinxes, representing triumph through determination and willpower. The Chariot symbolizes control, victory, and focused energy.

cards.name: Strength
cards.description: A woman gently tames a lion, representing inner strength, courage, and the power of compassion over force. Strength symbolizes patience, self-control, and emotional fortitude.

cards.name: The Hermit
cards.description: An old man holds a lantern aloft, illuminating the path of wisdom. The Hermit represents introspection, spiritual guidance, and the search for inner truth.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.description: A great wheel turns in the sky, representing the cycles of life, fate, and fortune. The Wheel of Fortune symbolizes destiny, karma, and life's ups and downs.

cards.name: Justice
cards.description: A figure holds scales and a sword, representing balance, fairness, and divine justice. Justice symbolizes truth, law, and the consequences of our actions.

cards.name: The Hanged Man
cards.description: A man hangs upside down from a tree, representing surrender, sacrifice, and seeing things from a new perspective. The Hanged Man symbolizes letting go and gaining wisdom through patience.

cards.name: Death
cards.description: Death rides a white horse, representing transformation, endings, and new beginnings. This card symbolizes change, renewal, and the natural cycle of life.

cards.name: Temperance
cards.description: An angel pours water between two cups, representing balance, harmony, and moderation. Temperance symbolizes patience, healing, and the middle path.

cards.name: The Devil
cards.description: Two figures are chained before a horned devil, representing bondage, materialism, and temptation. The Devil symbolizes our shadow self and the chains we create for ourselves.

cards.name: The Tower
cards.description: Lightning strikes a tall tower, sending figures tumbling down. The Tower represents sudden change, destruction of illusions, and dramatic awakening to truth.

cards.name: The Star
cards.description: A figure pours water under a starry sky, representing hope, healing, and spiritual guidance. The Star symbolizes faith, inspiration, and connection to the divine.

cards.name: The Moon
cards.description: The moon shines down on a mysterious landscape with a path leading into the unknown. The Moon represents illusion, intuition, and the mysteries of the subconscious mind.

cards.name: The Sun
cards.description: A radiant sun shines over a child on a white horse, representing joy, success, and positive energy. The Sun symbolizes happiness, vitality, and achievement.

cards.name: Judgement
cards.description: An angel blows a trumpet as figures rise from their graves, representing rebirth, awakening, and final judgement. Judgement symbolizes redemption and spiritual calling.

cards.name: The World
cards.description: A figure dances within a laurel wreath, representing completion, achievement, and cosmic consciousness. The World symbolizes fulfillment, success, and the end of a cycle.
